Characteristic.name: Cycling Power Measurement

InformativeText.Summary: The Cycling Power Measurement characteristic is a variable length structure containing a Flags field, an Instantaneous Power field and, based on the contents of the Flags field, may contain one or more additional fields as shown in the table below.

Field.name: Instantaneous Power
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in watts with a resolution of 1.

Field.name: Pedal Power Balance
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in percentage with a resolution of 1/2.

Field.name: Accumulated Torque
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in newton metres with a resolution of 1/32.

Field.name: Wheel Revolution Data - Cumulative Wheel Revolutions
Field.InformativeText: Unitless C1:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Wheel Revolution Data - Last Wheel Event Time
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in seconds with a resolution of 1/2048. C1:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Crank Revolution Data- Cumulative Crank Revolutions
Field.InformativeText: Unitless C2:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Crank Revolution Data- Last Crank Event Time
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in seconds with a resolution of 1/1024. C2:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Extreme Force Magnitudes - Maximum Force Magnitude
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in newtons with a resolution of 1. C3:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Extreme Force Magnitudes - Minimum Force Magnitude
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in newtons with a resolution of 1. C3:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Extreme Torque Magnitudes- Maximum Torque Magnitude
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in newton metres with a resolution of 1/32. C4:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Extreme Torque Magnitudes- Minimum Torque Magnitude
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in newton metres with a resolution of 1/32. C4:When present, these fields are always present as a pair.

Field.name: Extreme Angles - Maximum Angle
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in degrees with a resolution of 1 C5: When present, this field and the "Extreme Angles - Minimum Angle" field are always present as a pair and are concatenated into a UINT24 value (3 octets). As an example, if the Maximum Angle is 0xABC and the Minimum Angle is 0x123, the transmitted value is 0x123ABC.
Field.Description: When observed with the front wheel to the right of the pedals, a value of 0 degrees represents the angle when the crank is in the 12 o'clock position and a value of 90 degrees represents the angle, measured clockwise, when the crank points towards the front wheel in a 3 o'clock position. The left crank sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in the 12 o'clock position and the right sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in its 12 o'clock position; thus, there is a constant 180° difference between the right crank and the left crank position signals.

Field.name: Extreme Angles - Minimum Angle
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in degrees with a resolution of 1. C5: When present, this field and the "Extreme Angles - Maximum Angle" field are always present as a pair and are concatenated into a UINT24 value (3 octets). As an example, if the Maximum Angle is 0xABC and the Minimum Angle is 0x123, the transmitted value is 0x123ABC.
Field.Description: When observed with the front wheel to the right of the pedals, a value of 0 degrees represents the angle when the crank is in the 12 o'clock position and a value of 90 degrees represents the angle, measured clockwise, when the crank points towards the front wheel in a 3 o'clock position. The left crank sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in the 12 o'clock position and the right sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in its 12 o'clock position; thus, there is a constant 180° difference between the right crank and the left crank position signals.

Field.name: Top Dead Spot Angle
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in degrees with a resolution of 1.
Field.Description: When observed with the front wheel to the right of the pedals, a value of 0 degrees represents the angle when the crank is in the 12 o'clock position and a value of 90 degrees represents the angle, measured clockwise, when the crank points towards the front wheel in a 3 o'clock position. The left crank sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in the 12 o'clock position and the right sensor (if fitted) detects the 0° when the crank it is attached to is in its 12 o'clock position; thus, there is a constant 180° difference between the right crank and the left crank position signals.

Field.name: Bottom Dead Spot Angle
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in degrees with a resolution of 1.
Field.Description: When observed with the front wheel to the right of the pedals, a value of 0 degrees represents the angle when the crank is in the 12 o'clock position and a value of 90 degrees represents the angle, measured clockwise, when the crank points towards the front wheel in a 3 o'clock position. Field.name: Accumulated Energy
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in kilojoules with a resolution of 1.

Characteristic.Note: The fields in the above table, reading from top to bottom, are shown in the order of LSO to MSO, where LSO = Least Significant Octet and MSO = Most Significant Octet. The Least Significant Octet represents the eight bits numbered 0 to 7.
